Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by butterflytrans Your doctor is right that breast cancer is NORMALLY not painful, but there is an inflammatory variant of breast cancer which is painful....that said, there are other things that can cause breast pain. Believe it or not, even women not nursing are able to get mastitis. Quick question, are you on any medications at the moment? I am on thyroid meds and blood pressure meds, but have been on them for years and have had no pain before. I sometimes wonder if the squeezing them during the mammogram can cause damage. Thanks for you answer.
Posts.Title: could this be breast cancer?

Posts.Content: I am having a lot of pain in my breast. I just had my yearly mammogram 4 months ago and everything looked fine. My breast is very sore and has been for about 2 months on and off. It started out like a stabbing pain that you get with a charley horse and now aches quite often and deep. There is no lump. I mentioned it to my dr. and she just said there is usually not pain if cancer. I will have to go back and have it checked, but don't know what can be causing it. Has anyone experienced this/ I am in my 50's. Thanks
Posts.Title: could this be breast cancer?
